title: Comb space
summary: In mathematics, particularly topology, a comb space is a particular subspace of R 2 {\displaystyle \mathbb {R} ^{2}} that resembles a comb. The comb space has properties that serve as a number of counterexamples. The topologist's sine curve has similar properties to the comb space.  The deleted comb space is a variation on the comb space.
